question:
If you drop an object, it accelerates due to gravity ($\bm{F}_\mathrm{g} = m\bm{g}$), but also feels an increasing drag force as it speeds up ($\bm{F}_\mathrm{drag} = - \zeta \bm{v}$).
What will happen over time?

answers.answer: The object will reach a terminal velocity $v = \frac{mg}{\zeta}$
The object will continue to accelerate with $a = \frac{g}{\zeta}$
The object will start decelerating after a time $t = \frac{g}{\zeta}$
